body:
Remember that the linker command will be very OS, distribution and platform specific. You can see what GCC makes of it by letting it link with verbose output:

gcc -v -o foo foo.o

This is the most reliable and fastest way to get the command you need to call. This will include system library search directories, system libraries, and other often not so straightforward options.

I must strongly recommend against calling ld directly, for all the aforementioned reasons, unless you have a very specific use-case that warrants this.
title: How To Convert An Object File To Executable File (C Object File) Using Linker
